definition[0]: someone who will pay a debt, appear in court etc if someone else fails to do so
definition[1]: money someone gives to make sure that someone will appear in court
definition[2]: a person who promises to appear in court, pay a debt etc if someone else fails to do so
example[0]: The use of individual sureties grew sharply as contractors found it increasingly difficult to get insurance.
example[1]: He had acted as surety for both companies when they borrowed to finance the projects.
definition[3]: an amount of money or other things of value someone gives to make sure someone else will appear in court, pay a debt etc
example[2]: He was allowed out of custody with sureties totalling Â£12,000.
example[3]: a third party entering into acontract of surety
